caption:
“Who gets to define Americana?”

For Willy Chavarria, the answer has never been the status quo. From workwear to Catholic rosaries, exaggerated collars to the streets of Fresno, his runways aren’t just fashion—they’re statements, protests, love letters to a world that has tried to erase people like him. His latest collection, Tarantula, debuted just as the U.S. doubled down on stripping identities and histories. Chavarria resists, reclaims, and reimagines. Shot beside one of his muses, Paloma Elsesser, this cover story celebrates Willy and his community, sending the message that “How we love is who we are.”
